--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, jason r tibbetts <tibbettj@...> wrote:

> If =
the app class has a non-private constructor, then your tests don't 
> need =
to instantiate it as a singleton, right? And you also modifed the 
> app cl=
ass so that you can suppress the loading of the UI modules. What, 
> then, =
is impossible about having some tests instantiate the app without 
> the UI=
 bits, and other tests that do?

Nothing at all - that's exactly how it wor=
ks right now. It only bugs
me that I need to be extremely cautious about eg=
. closing documents
opened by the tested application - otherwise they don't=
 get "killed"
once the test is over, as everything is kept track of by the =
static,
everlasting instance, and might lead to unexpected interference.
Th=
at's why I wondered if what I do still comprises to the separateness
princi=
ple - but as I see nobody raises a protest.

Thanks,

Anna
